entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as indicating that everybody should start serving themselves.

entities.name: christmas day
entities.description: Christmas Day is mentioned as the unfortunate time for Professor Lupin's illness to happen.

entities.name: sibyll
entities.description: Sibyll is mentioned as being addressed by Dumbledore and McGonagall.

entities.name: mcgonagall
entities.description: McGonagall is mentioned as addressing Trelawney and having a conversation with her.

entities.name: trelawney
entities.description: Trelawney is mentioned as giving McGonagall a cold look and explaining her behavior to her.

entities.name: lupin
entities.description: Lupin is mentioned as being ill and not expected to be with the group for long, according to Trelawney's prophecy.

relationships.description: Trelawney gives McGonagall a cold look in response to her questioning.
McGonagall and Trelawney have a conversation about Trelawney's behavior and abilities.
Dumbledore mentions that Professor Lupin's illness is unfortunate because it happens on Christmas Day.
Trelawney sees a prophecy about Professor Lupin's death and shares this information with McGonagall.
